level.heading: Performance or acceptance under reservation of rights.

level.text: A party that with explicit reservation of rights performs, promises performance, or assents to performance in a manner demanded or offered by the other party does not thereby prejudice the rights reserved. Such words as "without prejudice," "under protest," or the like are sufficient.
Subsection (a) of this section does not apply to an accord and satisfaction.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 10-249
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 10-249, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 28:1-201.
